definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
to smuggle/to have an illicit affair
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly

sentences.english: The Oedipus business comes nearer to home.
sentences.chinese: 伊迪帕斯在朝家的方向走。

sentences.english: We'll be late for the meeting if we stay any longer.
sentences.chinese: 再不走我们开会就要迟到了。

sentences.english: He came in, holding a cigarette between his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴上叨着香烟走了进来。

sentences.english: One day, Einstein was walking in a street in New Youk.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，爱因斯坦走在纽约的大街上。

sentences.english: They opened the door and the four men alighted .
sentences.chinese: 他们打开车门，四个人都走了出来。

sentences.english: When the chicken crow, follow the chicken.
sentences.chinese: 鸡叫的时候，你就跟着鸡走。

sentences.english: Dumbledore took Harry in his arms and turned toward the Dursleys' house.
sentences.chinese: 邓布利多把哈利抱在怀里，朝德思礼家走去。

sentences.english: It took only a short walk on a Beijing street to find other foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 我在北京街头仅走了一小段路来寻找其他的外国人。

sentences.english: Keyes, however, was on foot at the back of the parade.
sentences.chinese: 然而，凯斯走在游行队伍的最后面。

sentences.english: The poor old man plods along, hardly able to lift each food.
sentences.chinese: 这可怜白勺白叟吃力地走着，几乎都抬不动脚了。

sentences.english: They decided to take the path of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定走自力更生的道路。

sentences.english: There is nothing like a long walk to arouse the appetite.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比走很长的路更能激起食欲的了。

sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟与一位行人撞了个满怀。

sentences.english: Now, Mr. Martin is on the 10 floor. The attendant comes to meet Mr. Matin.
sentences.chinese: 马丁先生到了十楼，服务员走过来迎接他。

sentences.english: I believe there is no way out of this forest.
sentences.chinese: 我相信没有戮由以从这森林走出去。

sentences.english: You are my life away a never-ending road.
sentences.chinese: 你是我一生走不完的路。

definition: itinerary/route/political line (e.g. right revisionist road)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
on the road/on a journey/road surface
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things
the whole journey/all the way/going the same way/going in the same direction/of the same kind
(neologism c. 2012) (interjection of encouragement) Let’s do this!/Come on, you can do this!
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
